course_title: Special Topics: Human Health: Qualitative Health Research
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 19 / Seats Avail: 19Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: This course explores qualitative methodologies used in health research and principles for responsible and ethical research conduct. Topics included are theory's role in research, research ethics, research design, and key qualitative methods employed in human health research. Students will engage in interactive discussions, case studies, and practical exercises to reinforce their understanding of qualitative research methodologies and ethical considerations in health research. Throughout the course, students will critically reflect on challenges and dilemmas that may arise in qualitative health research.
course_description: Seminar of lecture series of topics in human health. May be repeated for credit when topic varies. Credit varies from one to four hours.
sections: Class Nbr: 2682, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 2:30-3:45p, Instructor: A. Fitzroy, Status: Open
